content.text: *The Quick Brown Fox Jumps Over The Lazy Dog

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AudioByName
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Play audio with an expression as filename.
description: Allows for playing a sound resource by filename as a string. This also allows for dynamically selecting a filename via string expressions, which can be useful for things like reducing the number of events required for playing voiced dialogue in larger games or dynamic music based on the current room.
Please note, you may need to preload your audio files via events or resources panel because of how resources are now loaded gradually.

eventsFunctions.description:
Play a music file on a specific channel by name or string expression. 
This can be useful to reduce the number of events needed to dynamically play different music files.  e.g. Playing music based off a room ID variable for the current room the player is in.

Note: Music files should be preloaded before using these actions, such at the start of the first scene, current scene, or in the resources panel for the entire game. This is to avoid any potential audio pause since the normal resource loading at the start of the game or scene won't load these files by default. For web games, music files must be preloaded to start at all.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Play music on a channel by name
eventsFunctions.name: PlayMusicOnChannelByName
eventsFunctions.sentence: Play the music _PARAM1_ on channel _PARAM2_, loop: _PARAM3_, volume: _PARAM4_, pitch: _PARAM5_

parameters.longDescription: The final string must match the full resource name as displayed in the resource list.
parameters.name: Music

eventsFunctions.description:
Play a sound file on a specific channel by name or string expression. 
This can be useful to reduce the number of events needed to dynamically play different sound files. e.g. Playing a voice over line based off the current dialogue node name.

Note: Sound files should be preloaded before using these actions, such at the start of the first scene, current scene, or in the resources panel for the entire game. This is to avoid any potential audio pause since the normal resource loading at the start of the game or scene won't load these files by default.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Play sound on a channel by name
eventsFunctions.name: PlaySoundOnChannelByName
eventsFunctions.sentence: Play the sound _PARAM1_ on channel _PARAM2_, loop: _PARAM3_, volume: _PARAM4_, pitch: _PARAM5_

parameters.longDescription: The final string must match the full resource name as displayed in the resource list.
parameters.name: Sound

eventsFunctions.description: Preload a sound file by name or string expression.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Preload a sound file by name
eventsFunctions.name: PreloadSoundByName

parameters.longDescription: The final string must match the full resource name as displayed in the resource list.
parameters.name: Sound

eventsFunctions.description: Preload a music file by name or string expression.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Preload a music file by name
eventsFunctions.name: PreloadMusicByName

parameters.longDescription: The final string must match the full resource name as displayed in the resource list.
parameters.name: Music

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
description: Reveal a text one letter after the other (a "typewriter" effect).
It can be used for dialogue scenes or visual novels on Text and Bitmap Text objects.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Jump to a specific position in the text. Positions start at "0" and increase by one for every character.

eventsFunctions.name: ShowFullText

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/) and Entropy (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClvkb12nOWFgWnQ56NF9Rcw)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShadowClones
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create and animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object.
description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will reduce opacity and size (if desired), the Z-value and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
This extension can be used to:
- Make an object look faster, such as during a speed powerup.
- Give a 3D-like feel to a character
- Implement unique time-based elements, like teleporting a character back to a previous location
- Simulate the movement of a caterpillar or slinky
- Recreate games like snake or tron
These object variables are provided to manage the shadow clones:
- ShadowCloneOrder: Shadow clone identifier, where 1 is the shadow clone closest to the primary object
- FramesBehindPrimary: The number of frames that the shadow clone is behind the primary object
Notes:
- For shadow clones to work, this action must be run every frame.
- The ShadowCloneObject cannot be the PrimaryObject, but it can be a duplicate object.
- For animations to work, the PrimaryObject and ShadowCloneObject must use the same animation numbers.
Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/2t4ANYgrrak) to see examples of how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will fade away (if desired), the Z-value of the shadow clones, and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create and animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that follow the position of _PARAM1_, with _PARAM4_ empty frames between shadow clones, and fading the opacity of shadow clones by _PARAM5_ per clone.  Shrink scale of shadow clones by _PARAM6_ per clone. Shadow clones will be created on _PARAM7_ layer with a Z-value of _PARAM8_.  Match X scale: _PARAM9_  Match Y scale: _PARAM10_  Match angle: _PARAM11_  Match animation: _PARAM12_  Match animation frame: _PARAM13_  Match vertical flip: _PARAM14_ Match horizontal flip: _PARAM15_

events.comment: Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadow clones (but only when there is position data)
Create shadow clones and link them to the primary object

events.name: Change shadow clones based on the history of the PrimaryObject

events.comment: Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Change opacity of shadow clone (if requested)
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones.  Reset counter variable.
Reset temp variable for iterating through child objects
Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadows
Create shadow clones at proper intervals and link them to the primary object
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Update FramesBehindPrimary if the FramesBetweenShadowClones has changed
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones or changed distance between clones.  Reset counter variable.
Reset temp variable for iterating through child objects
Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1

parameters.description: Object that shadow clones will follow
parameters.name: PrimaryObject

parameters.description: Shadows clones will be made of this object (Cannot be the same object used for primary object)
parameters.name: ShadowCloneObject

parameters.description: Number of empty frames between shadow clones (Default: 1)
parameters.name: FramesBetweenShadowClones

parameters.longDescription: Decrease in opacity for each consecutive shadow clone
parameters.name: FadeSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Decrease in scale for each consecutive shadow clone
parameters.name: ShrinkSpeed

parameters.description: Shadow clones will be created on this layer. (Default: "") (Base Layer)
parameters.name: ShadowCloneLayer

parameters.description: Z value for created shadow clones
parameters.name: ShadowCloneZValue

parameters.description: Match X scale of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchScaleX

parameters.description: Match Y scale of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchScaleY

parameters.description: Match animation frame of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchAnimationFrame

parameters.description: Match the vertical flip of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchVerticalFlip

parameters.description: Match the horizontal flip of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchHorizontalFlip

eventsFunctions.fullName: Delete shadow clone objects that are linked to a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: DeleteShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete all _PARAM2_ that are linked to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Shake objects with translation and rotation.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
